Authors:
Ursula Eberhardt, Henry J. Beker, Jan Vesterholt, Nicole
Schuetz
Title:
The Taxonomy of the European Species of Hebeloma sect.
Denudata
Abstract:
Hebeloma section Denudata includes the majority of the
taxa commonly referred to as the Hebeloma crustuliniforme complex. In a
recent paper we described in detail H. subsection Denudata and fifteen
European species recognized within this subsection. In this paper we
continue this work and describe in detail three additional subsections,
building upon our work above and complementing the work of D.K. Aanen
and co-workers. Using refined morphological and molecular methods we
have been able to recognize individual taxa within these subsections.
Within H. subsection Hiemalia, we recognise just one species, Hebeloma
hiemale. Here we propose an epitype in order to unambiguously define
this taxon. Nine species occurring in Europe are assigned to H. subsect.
Clepsydroida, namely: Hebeloma ammophilum, H. cavipes, H. fragilipes, H.
ingratum, H. laetitiae, H. limbatum, H. matritensis, H. pseudofragilipes
and H. vaccinum. Of these, we describe three as new, namely H. limbatum,
H. matritensis and H. pseudofragilipes. Finally, we introduce H.
subsection Echinospora with three species: Hebeloma echinosporum, H.
populinum and H. rostratum. Although only two of these are described as
new, we provide descriptions of all three of these species in order to
clarify the taxonomy of this section. We provide a key to H. section
Denudata. We demonstrate that within these subsections there is good
overall consistency between morphological, phylogenetic and biological
species concepts.
